The 10 Most Revolutionary Pieces of Technology in the 21st Century

The tech industry is one of the most rapidly developing industries in the world. In the past 22 years Technology Industries have made leaps and bounds compared to other titans of industry. Names like Apple, Microsoft, Samsung, and Tesla have dominated the market with their products with billions of people using their products daily.

  1. iPhone

    When the iPhone first came out it took the world by storm. The ability to use your finger just to tap on the screen instead of using buttons was a game changer. Now almost everyone in the world has an iPhone.

  2. Google

    When Google went public in 2004 it quickly became one of the most popular web browsers in North America. It quickly expanded to the entire world, it is now the most world wide web browser ever created.

  3. Flash Drives

    Before the flash drives, the main way of storing large amounts of data was floppy disks. The flash drive was released in 2000, and it gave us the ability to store larger amounts of data in a more convenient and smaller device.

  4. Bluetooth

    When Bluetooth devices hit stores in 2001 it gave us the ability of Wireless connectivity and hands-free calling. We use bluetooth almost daily, connecting to wireless speakers or headphones to listen to music or to take calls without even having to take our phones out of our pockets.

  5. 4G

    Before 4G was publicly available in 2009 most of the world was using 3G which is significantly slower. When 4G was implemented, it greatly increased both upload and download speeds which increased power significantly affected people's internet speed.

  6. Self-Driving Cars

    The self-driving car has revolutionised the automotive industry. The ability for a car to take you anywhere with just simple coordinates is astonishing. Even though the technology is still in its early stages it is quickly advancing. And in a couple of years the entire world will be using driverless cars.

  7. Youtube

    When Youtube was founded in 2005 it quickly became popular for its ability to post and share video contact with anyone around the world. It is now the second most visited website in the world just behind Google.

  8. Uber

    Uber was the first ride-sharing company to be created. It was founded in 2009 and has replaced taxi cabs as the main source of transportation.

  9. 3D Printers

    3D printers give us the ability to create almost anything with just a simple printer. They can be used in multiple fields and are practically versatile in their applications. The 3D printer has revolutionised the way we build and create devices.

  10. Skype

    During these past couple years we realise how important video calling and chatting have been. When Skype first came out in 2003 it gave us the ability to use the internet to connect with people through our computers.
